===== status.ubuntu.com =====

** New site http://status.ubuntu.com/ubuntu-oneiric/ is being rolled out to help track work items.
*** Builds on the infrastructure created by status.linaro.org, and customized for ubuntu by Chris Johnston (cjohnston) with help from James Westby, Martin Pitt, Paul Collins and the Ubuntu web team. 
*** It provides the capability for blueprints to be grouped across traditional teams, and track what is needed to implement a specific feature.  Effectively this is implemented using meta blueprints labeled with "topic-oneiric-..." 
** Meta blueprint or "topic-" setup   
*** These meta-blueprints are fairly straight forward to set up,  and rely on linkages made with dependencies.  Its important not to put work items in them - only link to other actual blueprints.
*** Some examples of use:
**** <nowiki>[[http://status.ubuntu.com/ubuntu-oneiric/group/topic-oneiric-arm-server.html|ARM Server Development]]</nowiki>
**** <nowiki>[[http://status.ubuntu.com/ubuntu-oneiric/group/topic-oneiric-edubuntu.html|Edubuntu plans for Oneiric]]</nowiki>
**** <nowiki>[[http://status.ubuntu.com/ubuntu-oneiric/group/topic-oneiric-release-management.html|Release Management Improvements for Oneiric]]</nowiki>
*** Documentation on how to set up "topic-oneiric-" meta-blueprints will be created next week,  mail out to ubuntu-devel once documentation is in place. 
*** If you have questions or want to start setting up a topic before documentation available, please ping skaet, cjohnston, or wendar on IRC
